intro: Cerastium jiuhuashanense, commonly known as the Jiuhuashan chickweed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically opposite and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are prostrate and often creeping. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky habitats.
